intro: Onosma echinata, commonly known as the spiked everlasting, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or dry habitats. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically hairy and have a distinctive, wrinkled appearance. Onosma echinata is known for its long-lasting flowers, which remain intact for extended periods, contributing to its common name.
